communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All email communications from jolson@chla.usc.edu to UCSF or from UCSF to jolson@chla.usc.edu from the time period of July of 2016 thru March 6, 2024.  

jolson@chla.usc.edu is the email of the NIH funded researcher Johanna Olson.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Laidlaw

title: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (secretary of state)

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (secretary of state)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on local ballot initiatives/referenda that took place in the state since 1972. Specifically, I need the following information to be included in the data.

1. Text of the ballot initiative/referendum
2. Local government where the election took place.
3. County where the local government is located
4. Election date
5. Result of election (votes for, votes against, pass/fail)
6. Threshold to pass (50%, two-thirds, etc)

This website from California provides a good example of the type of data I am requesting:
https://data.ca.gov/dataset/election-data/resource/67e83a65-2b55-41ec-9420-b33b666d4711

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Jimin Han

communications.subject: RE: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (secretary of state)
communications.communication:
In Wisconsin, voter registration and elections are overseen by the Elections Commission, not the Secretary of State Office.  You can contact Elections for further information at 608-266-8005 or via https://elections.wi.gov/

The legislature in Wisconsin has control over setting elections in Wisconsin.  I would advise you to reach out to your legislator if you have any concerns.  If you are unsure who may represent you, you can find your legislator through maps.legis.wisconsin.gov<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3A__maps.legis.wisconsin.gov_&d=DwMFAg&c=HhgxO5mnlCoNHjwVH-wED6Mwc4Z-psO9z_38k9ow5oI&r=Ir5BBZ1NfD0SXloKv7gtezQ105JY2_LIwTRmx61iGs4&m=WYvXcrE7Fbeul6YSl_nb4u9rJAnZ2vme7VO2Q21rXf0&s=aRDj_iVorNyKKUnzsfudlovLPtKlgdbLfwqIiYjok4Q&e=>.  Use the search box in the upper right corner to enter your address.
Best,

Jessa




[Logo  Description automatically generated]


Office of the Secretary of State, Wisconsin
statesec@wisconsin.gov<mailto:statesec@wisconsin.gov>
www.sos.wi.gov<http://www.sos.wi.go/>
Phone: 608-266-8888

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Data Request for Local Ballot Initiatives/Referenda (Secretary of State)
communications.communication:
Good morning,

These records will be held with the Georgia Archives. Please visit: Contact Us | Georgia Archives<https://www.georgiaarchives.org/about/contact>
Best,

Open Records Staff

communications.subject: Your Washington Secretary of State public records request #24-165 has been opened.
communications.communication:
Washington Secretary of State ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-165 has been submitted successfully. As the requester, you can always see the status of your request by signing into the Washington Secretary of State portal. If you haven't already signed in, you may need to activate or setup your account to get started. Once your account is activated, you can communicate directly with the Washington Secretary of State through NextRequest. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact Washington Secretary of State.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center
